channel.title: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?
channel.description:
Its so hard to describe your own music. You may be able to describe what you are/were going for but understanding how others are perceiving your music can be really helpful. If you know what other people like about your music you can better promote yourself. Write it in your bio, use it to describe your music to friends, family*, and any potential listeners. In the spirit of these other topics. https://disco.auxy.co/t/what-makes-your-style-unique/7643 https://disco.auxy.co/t/who-would-you-want-to-learn-producing-skills-from-in-auxy If you do both you can see if you are hitting what you are going for... or if you should lean into something that you didn't realize you were good at.

Rules: 1) Listen to and describe the 3+ people** before you so that everyone that participates gets multiple perspectives and opinions. 2) Please **be nice** - this is _not_ a roast topic, and the intention is _not_ to slam anyone. Say what you like about their style, there is something positive in all of them. 3) You can jump in more than once. 4) You don't _necessarily_ have to do someone if you don't have anything new to add. Think not just about genre, but techniques, composition, energy, feel, etc... Feel free to give references to specific songs. Most people do many genres or a fusion of them. [spoiler] *(thinking about the auxian who's parents wanted him to do anything besides this)[/spoiler] **(obviously the first three people won't be able to do three, but whoever it is can jump in again later if they like.

[spoiler] To many words... I think I'm rambling... oh jeez I'm first. Not sure I'm ready for this. :cold_sweat:[/spoiler]

item.title: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
@TXA Love how melodious & upbeat your songs are! I feel like dancing to them xD
@LilSpikes Cool dark sounds. =P Your remix of IVO’s track really showcases that spicy feel lol.
@TheRealJFalc Jfalc, your songs are really original! I love how you always make what you like. Had a blast remixing Re/Fragmented btw x3

Read full topic
item.source: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?

item.title: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
@LilSpikes Your music is… spikey ;3 lol I love how much work you put into your stuff
@TXA your stuff is electrifying. High energy trap and future bass, while not necessarily my cup of tea, is really well done.
@Zoruwhite Your stuff is a trap ;3 Sorry I just had to. It’s really nice and well done, and while I don’t traditionally like future bass and the sorts it’s pretty cool

Read full topic

item.title: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?
item.dc:creator: LittleSpikes
item.description:
Nice thread!! Hope this one thrives.

@Cheddr… sounds are rather sharp but track is always smooth, very unique and fresh percussion
@Indigoo…very good at using light sounds(like sounds from melodic percussion pack), repetitive melodies but never get tired of (which is so impressive) +パ!
@Mr_Mooo… solid and clear structure (intro, build, drop, chorus), love how he uses piano sounds
@Zoruwhite…nailing using unstable melodies for main melodies. Rather dark and mysterious.

Read full topic

item.title: [Forum Game] What makes the style of the three people before you unique?
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
Its so hard to describe your own music. You may be able to describe what you are/were going for but understanding how others are perceiving your music can be really helpful.

If you know what other people like about your music you can better promote yourself. Write it in your bio, use it to describe your music to friends, family*, and any potential listeners.

In the spirit of these other topics.

What makes your style unique? Production Talk
Not only your genre, but what certain sounds/styles make your music unique to you? If you don’t really find yourself at a unique style yet, what other Auxy producers do you draw from when making your music?

https://disco.auxy.co/t/who-would-you-want-to-learn-producing-skills-from-in-auxy

If you do both you can see if you are hitting what you are going for… or if you should lean into something that you didn’t realize you were good at.



Rules:

  1. Listen to and describe the 3+ people** before you so that everyone that participates gets multiple perspectives and opinions.
  2. Please be nice - this is not a roast topic, and the intention is not to slam anyone. Say what you like about their style, there is something positive in all of them.
  3. You can jump in more than once.
  4. You don’t necessarily have to do someone if you don’t have anything new to add.

Think not just about genre, but techniques, composition, energy, feel, etc…
Feel free to give references to specific songs. Most people do many genres or a fusion of them.

spoiler

**(obviously the first three people won’t be able to do three, but whoever it is can jump in again later if they like.




spoiler

Read full topic
